title: Daiwa loses UK duty of care appeal case, faces $150 million bill
text:
Daiwa Securities Group's logo is pictured at its headquarters in Tokyo, Japan January 30, 2017. REUTERS/Kim Kyung-Hoon

LONDON (Reuters) - Daiwa Capital Markets Europe (8601.T) did breach a rule on checking a customer instruction for fraud, Britain’s top court ruled on Wednesday, leaving the Japanese investment bank facing a $150 million (£117 million) damages bill.

“The Supreme Court unanimously dismisses Daiwa’s appeal and upholds that the High Court order should stand,” the court said in a statement.

Such a ruling could prompt international banks to shift some corporate business away from London to cut their liability risk in future, financial sector officials have said.
